alert.note: Alert for Houston; Humphreys; Perry; Stewart; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 13 at 2:19AM CDT until March 14 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM CDT TO 9 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Stewart, Houston, Humphreys, Perry and Wayne Counties. * WHEN...From 2 AM CDT to 9 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With such warm temperatures so early into spring plants have begun to bloom. Low temperatures will drop to below freezing for 7 hours early Tuesday morning. Freezing conditions will likely again occur early Wednesday morning. Additional freeze products will likely be needed once again.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
